title: Sri Lanka cabinet nod for tabling IMF report in parliament
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers has approved a proposal by Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa to table the International Monetary Fund (IMF) report on the crisis-hit island nation.

A statement from the Government Information Department said: “The report on Sri Lanka issued for the year 2021 under Article 4 of the International Monetary Fund Agreement has been published on Saturday 2022.03.25. The cabinet of Ministers approved the proposal presented by the Minister of Finance to present this report in the parliament.”
Chief government whip Johnston Fernando on Monday (28) said the government planned to hold a parliamentary debate on the report early next month, according to media reports.

Former prime minister Ranil Wickremesinghe had earlier called for a debate on the report. Wickremesinghe and the finance minister had previously exchanged words over the government’s alleged hesitance to share the report with MPs.
